item.title: 2 mattresses plus more ribosomes, 5th September
item.description:
More mattresses dumped (2) plus various rubbish

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clevedon Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Distracting and intimidatory flags, 5th September
item.description:
Bexley claim this does not cause tension. What planet are they on? Clearly these flags have been raised to intimidate. I feel so unsafe in the borough now. This is going back to the 80s and 90s when the BNP were on the march. I was Stephen Lawrence’s age at the time and am reliving the terror of those times again. Please do something about this. It is really scary out there for people of colour.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crittall's Corner, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: ASH TREE FALLEN BRANCH 3m long and heavy onto london loop footpath, 5th September
item.description:

item.title: Tree Tarmacked outside the Coop at The Oval, 5th September
item.description:
Pavement Tarmacking on the Oval Sidcup, outside the Coop, this morning. 5th September. Tarmacked right up to tree like a lamppost. Tree will die if it does not have the ability to receive rainwater.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blackfen, London

item.title: Construction site works leaving excessive mud on road, 5th September
item.description:
The construction site on nags head lane (Arden Oaks) is fouling the public highway with mud and general construction waste which is being dropped from the Lorry’s and from the wheels of construction site traffic. This has been happening daily for the last two weeks and is unacceptable. I am sure as part of planning conditions this type of disruption is not allowed and a suitable wheel wash system should be in place. Pleas action accordingly. Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nag's Head Lane, Brentwood
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parking obstruction / Lime bikes/hire bikes, 5th September
item.description:
A member of public made contact to complain for a long period of time Lime Bicycles are constantly causing a nuisance. There are 30 to 35 outside the office Building blocking the fire evacuation. EC2A 3DQ/ Gate House, Rivintgton street There are between 60 and 70 people working out of the office block 5 days a week and endangering life of those who work with fire exits blocked constantly from outside.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1a, Rivington Street, Shoreditch, London
Report on FixMyStreet
